Banner.Description: I'm a Computer Science student pivoting from a career leading projects at Apple to pursue my fascination with software's ability to amplify social impact. I've been developing for 5 years, and currently lead two open source projects while I finish my CS degree in May 2025. I love helping people and I build tools using Typescript, Python, and various AI/ML techniques.
AboutMe.Title: About me
AboutMe.Paragraphs: In my 5 years developing software, I’ve made life easier for teammates at Apple and Dell, while spending my free time coding tools to amplify the efforts of the Center for Child Protection, local artists, and underpriveledged students. I’m currently leading two open source projects building an AI-native teaching assistant being used at Texas State University, and a mobile app being used by Meals On Wheels.

My leadership skills have been honed by incredible mentors while leading hundreds of projects at Apple, leading two student clubs with IEEE and Google, and founding/dissolving two startups. My software skills can be attributed to years in academic research, 3 internships, and building dozens of personal projects. I'm very comfortable in novel problem spaces.
My goal is to cultivate my engineering and leadership skills so I can help more people.
Experience.Title: Work Experience

Experience.Jobs.Title: Lead Software Engineer - AI Teaching Assistant
Description: Improved learning experiences for Computer Science students and faculty by creating an AI-native web app
Designed and deployed using Angular, Node, Express, PostgreSQL, Docker, OpenAI, and Railway for CICD
Interviewed, trained, and led a small team to deliver features using Agile and SDLC strategies in Jira
Implemented user feedback from students and professors using this in college courses

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Engineer
Description: Reduced food insecurity by coding an open-source, HIPAA compliant mobile app for Meals On Wheels
Worked on a team to implement features from stakeholder meetings using React-Native, Django, LDAP, PostgreSQL, Git, and an external Salesforce DB from Meals on Wheels.

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Engineering Intern
Description: Sped up contract negotiations for enterprise sales ($2.4 billion) using large language models
Deployed an internal app using Docker, Kubernetes, Langchain, Streamlit, and locally hosted LLMs
Led discussions on feasibility of training our own model versus using RAG, CoT, 0-shot, or fine-tuning
Extracted action items from user feedback surveys on an existing app. Used Python/Spacy and GPT-4

Experience.Jobs.Title: Online Instructor
Description: Taught kids Python, Machine Learning, and Web Dev

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Engineering Intern
Description: Reduced manual work for order support teams by combining database lookups into one tool
Saved 12 hours/week/person by automating the process of querying 7 different SQL and NoSQL databases from different regions and different generations of legacy, while elegantly handling errors

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Engineering Intern
Description: Increased integrity of 300 million customer records by writing tests for a streaming data pipeline
Replaced a low-code ETL data pipeline with custom C# code reading from a Kafka pub/sub queue and loading the structured data into an ElasticSearch data warehouse for analytics teams to ingest
Won First Place in the annual intern hackathon by automating the months-long process of matching of new-hires to managers/teams through interviews and surveys

Experience.Jobs.Title: Machine Learning Researcher
Description: Classified images of rare medical diseases by training and tuning a convolutional neural net
Investigated Stochastic Gradient Ascent (Google DeepDream) as a novel way to augment image datasets to increase training data without increasing cost of human labeling
Achieved custom image augmentation by coding Python to read images, convert them to tensors, and augment them using random combinations of overexcited concatenation layers of the InceptionV3 CNN.
Automated data processing and model training using 8 Nvidia GPUs in parallel on a remote Linux server

Experience.Jobs.Title: Teaching Assistant - CS3398
Description: Taught 80 students full-stack software engineering under an Engineer-in-Residence from Meta

Experience.Jobs.Title: Software Engineering Researcher
Description: Created a cloud with 7 raspberry pi’s to maintain homeostasis across plants and fish using solar power.
Published peer-reviewed research on resilient systems using FMEA and Digital Twin.

Experience.Jobs.Title: Senior Fraud Specialist
Description: Taught myself Python and Javascript to automate my role and take on more responsibilities
Saved Apple $1Billion every year by coaching a team of 140 fraud investigators
Conducted investigations involving phone interviewing of criminals
Led over 250 community service events to connect employees with nonprofits

FeatureProjects.Title: My projects
FeatureProjects.Label: Featured Project

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Agrourbana
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: Monitoring application made from scratch with auth module, configurable graphics, configurable alarms, and user management. It also has feedback form logic for parameter configuration.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Tu super plan
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: Health plan quote that has a search engine with which advanced queries are made. Plans are displayed based on the user's age, monthly income, and location. It has online chatcontact form, notification system by whatsapp and mail, auth, and internet information management through the role of administrator.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Proyexiot
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: Data monitoring platform belonging to water wells, tugboats, and various installations made from scratch with auth module, configurable graphics, configurable alarms, user management, and geolocation with openlayers.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Hands game
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: The rock-paper-scissors game extended. A personal project developed in angular in which you play randomly against the machine. It has the use of services, interfaces, and components.

FeatureProjects.Projects.Title: Countries viewer
FeatureProjects.Projects.Description: An interface that consumes an API of countries with which you can view a list of countries, see details of each country, filter by name and region. It also has a dark mode to switch between dark and light themes.

OtherProjects.Projects.Description: Automated an intelligent, solar-powered, aquaponic farm using 7 Raspberry Pi's attempting to impact world hunger. This code kept 20+ Tilapia alive by keeping chemical levels at equillibrium.

Contact.Title: Get in touch!
Contact.Content: I'm happy to learn about your work or collaborate on projects that make the world a better place.
